artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait (bijin-ga); woman in profile from PL, wearing a white flower in her short, wavy hair, with a turquoise kimono and multicolored obi; woman holds a small container with 4 fireflies and a fan, and watches a firefly in ULC
inscription: 昭和六年七月 {Shōwa rokunen shichigatsu} (July 1931)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 深水 {Shinsui}; LRC, publisher seal: ワタナベ {Watanabe} | on back, red seal: 貮百五拾枚絶版　第貮百四拾貮番 {nihyakugojū mai zeppan, dai nihyakuyonjūni ban} (edition of 250, number 242); red square publisher seal: わたなべ {Watanabe}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The First Collection of Modern Beauties (Gendai bijin shū dai isshū 現代美人集第一輯)
text: A young woman with Western hairstyle carries a cage with three fireflies that she already caught and she is looking out for a fourth flying right in front of her.
title: Firefly Catching
